Product_Name: Kiki Coto
r_1: It was a terrific read! The author has an eclectic way of personifying the real-world evils of the exploited systems into the magnificent characters. The book perfectly depicts the corruption and lacunae in the system and how the elite class uses it for its advantages. It also has beautifully explored the complex and ecstatic character Kiki Coto  the protagonist of the story. Overall, I highly recommend this if youre looking for a justice-esq theme story which oscillates the moral compass of the society.
r_2: Once you start reading, from the very first pages, you just can't stop. The author writes with a great pace and have the ability to make every single part of the plot interesting. Going through the very shady parts of corruption aligned with criminal organizations, Kiki Coto is capable of create a white collar crime story that differentiate from any other that I've read. A read to remember!
r_3: Kiki Coto opens our eyes to the world of corruption and how broken the system really is. It goes beyond the physical world into a spiritual journey and makes us ponder upon how our thoughts and actions emit energy that affect us beyond this life. Just as the circles of corruption are all intertwined, our souls are all connected. We are all energy, we are all one, and we need to take care of our energy and each other. A powerful story, easy to read !
r_4: Kiki Coto starts and ends with a bang! The very first paragraph draws you in and makes you want more! This was a very interesting story with lots of twists and turns and a very satisfying ending. In future books I would love to see more character development and descriptive scene-setting, but overall great story!
r_5: In a fast pace of unforeseeable developments, the author exposes the convoluted plots and the modus operandi of the sophisticated elite of the society and the way they carry out their criminal activities hiding behind charitable organizations. Once you start reading, you will forget all about Covid and its variants.
r_6: An excellent read, Avanessys work, in a very real sense, complements George Orwells Nineteen Eighty-Four. Orwell exposes the totalitarian nature of modern state. Avanessy skillfully and brilliantly focuses on the other side of the coin: the pervasive corruption, with all the attendant injustice and suffering.
r_7: Absolutely a great read, as a new mom it is nice to open a book that stimulates and engages the mind that is not puppets or ABC's.  Wonderfully written and makes you feel right there with the characters of the book.
